RT @SenBlumenthal ‘Best by’ date labels on items aren’t based on safety or science. These confusing, completely arbitrary labels lead to perfectly safe food going to waste. The Food Date Labeling Act would establish a uniform national labeling system—providing people with much needed clarity. https://twitter.com/chelliepingree/status/1156927885657202688 QT @chelliepingree "𝗕𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗯𝘆" 
"𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗯𝘆" 
"𝗦𝗲𝗹𝗹 𝗯𝘆" 
"𝗙𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗼𝗻" 
"𝗘𝘅𝗽𝗶𝗿𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗻"
These are just some of the phrases on American food labels. 40% of all food produced in the US is wasted, in part due to a confusing patchwork of terms. We need a uniform date label. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EA47w7KWkAEsVxT.jpg

‘Best by’ date labels on items aren’t based on safety or science. These confusing, completely arbitrary labels lead to perfectly safe food going to waste. The Food Date Labeling Act would establish a uniform national labeling system—providing people with much needed clarity. https://twitter.com/chelliepingree/status/1156927885657202688 QT @chelliepingree "𝗕𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗯𝘆" 
"𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗯𝘆" 
"𝗦𝗲𝗹𝗹 𝗯𝘆" 
"𝗙𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗼𝗻" 
"𝗘𝘅𝗽𝗶𝗿𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗻"
These are just some of the phrases on American food labels. 40% of all food produced in the US is wasted, in part due to a confusing patchwork of terms. We need a uniform date label. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EA47w7KWkAEsVxT.jpg

RT @justinamash An important note for people talking about the federal budget:

Spending bills are valued over a one-year period. Tax bills are valued over a 10-year period.

In other words, a $1.3T spending bill is 10x larger than a $1.3T tax bill. The spending bill has 10x the deficit impact.

I expect we will see many more retirements among Texas Republicans at all levels of government.
